title: The Relationship Between Sports Performance and Emotional Processes: Exploration Through Nonlinear Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of fundamental sports theories and experiences, along with basic emotional regulation concepts
context.additional_context: Learners analyze the impact of emotional processes on performance based on real-world sports experiences and undertake self-directed learning projects using nonlinear pedagogical approaches

learning_goals: Learners can explain the impact of various emotion-eliciting conditions (positive/negative feedback) on sports performance using experimental data.
Applying nonlinear instructional methods, learners design and implement strategies to monitor individual emotional states.
Through project-based assessment, learners collaborate with team members to propose emotional management plans for improving sports performance.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
